task.description: 设计一种在25度下能够尽可能多溶解电极材料中贵金属的5组分DES溶剂

components.name: Choline chloride
components.function: Primary hydrogen bond acceptor and structural backbone

components.name: Ethylene glycol
components.function: Hydroxyl-rich hydrogen bond donor, enhances solvation via coordination

components.name: Glycerol
components.function: Polyol-based HBD that improves viscosity and stabilizes metal complexes

components.name: Urea
components.function: Amide-functionalized donor enabling Lewis base interactions and melting point depression

components.name: ZnCl₂
components.function: Lewis acidic component promoting oxidative dissolution of noble metals

reasoning: This 5-component DES leverages multiple hydrogen bond donors (EG, Gly, Urea) with complementary functional groups to create a deep eutectic network that remains liquid at 25°C while enhancing solvation capacity for noble metals. The inclusion of ZnCl₂ at a sub-stoichiometric ratio (0.5) provides mild oxidative capability without disrupting phase homogeneity, as higher ratios lead to solidification. Multi-HBD synergy lowers the system’s melting point and increases donor diversity for coordinating oxidized noble metal species, improving solubility under ambient conditions.

final_result.reasoning: This 5-component DES leverages multiple hydrogen bond donors (EG, Gly, Urea) with complementary functional groups to create a deep eutectic network that remains liquid at 25°C while enhancing solvation capacity for noble metals. The inclusion of ZnCl₂ at a sub-stoichiometric ratio (0.5) provides mild oxidative capability without disrupting phase homogeneity, as higher ratios lead to solidification. Multi-HBD synergy lowers the system’s melting point and increases donor diversity for coordinating oxidized noble metal species, improving solubility under ambient conditions.
supporting_evidence: ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) forms a stable liquid DES at 25°C and achieves 1.0 g/L noble metal solubility (Experience 1 & 4)
Multiple HBDs (urea, EG, glycerol) contribute synergistically to hydrogen bonding networks, enabling sufficient melting point depression (Experience 3)
ZnCl₂ acts as a Lewis acid to facilitate partial oxidation of noble metals even at room temperature (Experience 1)
Increasing ZnCl₂ to 1.0 molar ratio disrupts DES formation, indicating optimal performance at lower concentrations (Experience 5)
final_result.synergy_explanation: Choline chloride accepts hydrogen bonds from ethylene glycol, glycerol, and urea, forming an extensive H-bond network that depresses the eutectic point below 25°C. Ethylene glycol and glycerol provide hydroxyl groups that coordinate with dissolved metal ions, while urea contributes both H-bond donation and weak basicity to stabilize cationic species. ZnCl₂ introduces Lewis acidity that promotes oxidative dissolution of noble metals without crystallizing the mixture due to balanced ionic disruption, enabled by the buffering effect of the multi-HBD environment.
memories_used: ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) Achieves 1.0 g/L Noble Metal Solubility at 25°C
Multi-HBD DES with Gly, EG, and Urea Enables Noble Metal Solubilization at 25°C
Urea- and Polyol-Based HBDs Enable 5-Component DES Formation at 25°C
ChCl:EG:Gly:Urea:ZnCl₂ (1:2:1:1:0.5) Achieves 1.0 g/L Noble Metal Solubility at 25°C
Increasing ZnCl₂ Ratio to 1.0 Inhibits DES Formation in 5-Component System at 25°C
